title: Tyson Fury sizes up Oleksandr Usyk as Ukrainian books ringside spot for Anthony Joshua fight
text:
Fury got a good look at Usyk (Picture: Getty)

Tyson Fury took his chance to size up Oleksandr Usyk when the pair met ringside at Artur Beterbiev’s unification triumph over Oleksandr Gvozdyk.

Usyk was in Philadelphia to support the beaten Gvozdyk when Fury made a beeline for him.

Fury is one of the heavyweight’s supreme operators and Usyk has just made a winning debut in the division.

A seventh-round stoppage win over Chazz Witherspoon this month was a soft introduction to the division, but that did not stop the former undisputed cruiserweight king from calling out all the top champions.

Anthony Joshua and Deontay Wilder were subject of call-outs from Usyk, as was lineal champion Fury.

Fury shook the hand of Usyk before saying: ‘Stand up, let me see how big you are.’

The Gypsy King then coped a cheeky feel, with both men laughing in a friendly interaction.

While Fury weighs up a clash with Usyk in the future, the Ukrainian will be ringside for Anthony Joshua’s next fight.

Joshua’s bid for revenge against Andy Ruiz Jr in December could see the British heavyweight reclaim the world titles he lost to the Mexican during the summer.

Usyk will be ringside for Joshua’s clash with Ruiz Jr (Picture: Getty)

Usyk could be the next man to take on Joshua if he is victorious as he is the mandatory challenger to the WBO title.

Eddie Hearn confirmed Usyk was demanding a championship fight and expects to face one of the division’s champions in his next outing.

Fury, on the other hand, is booked for a WWE match at the end of the month before his rematch with Wilder next February.
